intro: Diplycosia barbigera, commonly known as the hairy diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
